header.title: Bachelors of Mathematics / Computer Science
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 64 units comprising:

  • 32 units for Bachelor of Mathematics component, and
  • 32 units for Bachelor of Computer Science component

header.ruleLogic: Part A.1 AND Part A.2 AND ( Part A.3 OR Part A.4 )
header.title: Bachelor of Mathematics component
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 32 units comprising:

  • 8 units for BMath Core Courses, and
  • 16 units for one Major from BMath Major List, and
  • Either:
  • 8 units for BMath Minor Option, or
  • 8 units for BMath No Minor Option

header.title: BMath Core Courses
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 8 units comprising:

  • 8 units for all BMath Core Courses

header.notes: Students with a grade of B or higher in Queensland Specialist Mathematics (or equivalent) (or a 6 or 7 in MATH1050) are recommended to take the sequence MATH1071, MATH1072 and MATH2401. Students with a grade of C in Queensland Specialist Mathematics (or equivalent) (or a 4 or 5 in MATH1050), should take the sequence MATH1051, MATH1052 and MATH2400.

selectionRule.text: Complete [N] units for ALL of the following:

header.title: BMath Core Courses

curriculumReference.name: Advanced Multivariate Calculus & Ordinary Differential Equations

header.title: BMath Minor Option
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 8 units comprising:

  • 8 units for one Minor from BMath Minor List

header.title: BMath No Minor Option
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 8 units comprising:

  • 0 to 8 units from BMath Program Elective Courses, and
  • 0 to 8 units from BMath Program Elective Courses (from Plans)

selectionRule.text: Complete [N] to [M] units from the following:

body.notes: Research, Placement, and Work Integrated Learning Courses
Research, Placement, and Work Integrated Learning Courses

header.notes: Any courses from the above plans can be completed as program electives.

selectionRule.text: Complete [N] to [M] units from the following:

header.title: BMath Program Elective Courses (from Plans)

header.ruleLogic: Part B.1 and Part B.2 and Part B.3
header.title: Bachelor of Computer Science component
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 32 units comprising:

  • 14 units for all BCompSc Core Courses, and
  • 16 units for BCompSc Plan Options, and
  • 2 units from BCompSc Program Elective Courses

selectionRule.text: Complete [N] units for ALL of the following:

header.title: BCompSc Plan Options
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 16 units for either of the following:

  • 16 units for one Major from BCompSc Major Options, or
  • 16 units for BCompSc No Major Option

header.ruleLogic: Part B.2.2.1 and B.2.2.2 and B.2.2.3
header.title: BCompSc No Major Option
header.summaryDescription:
Complete 16 units comprising:

  • 2 units for all Computer Science Extension Courses, and
  • 8 units from Computer Science Introductory Elective Courses, and
  • 6 units from Computer Science Advanced Elective Courses

curriculumReference.name: Software Engineering Studio: Design, Implement & Test
Advanced Techniques for High Dimensional Data

header.notes: BCompSc program electives means any courses on the BCompSc course list.

selectionRule.text: Complete exactly [N] units from the following:

header.title: BCompSc Program Elective Courses

payload.value:
1.  Program Plan

1.1 Where a course is compulsory in one component of the dual program but not the other, then it must be counted towards the component in which it is compulsory.

1.2 Where a course is compulsory in both a BMath major or minor, and a BCompSc major or the BCompSc core courses, then it may be counted towards either:

(a) the BMath and substituted in the BCompSc by a course at the same level or higher from the Computer Science Introductory Electives or Computer Science Advanced Electives lists of the BCompSc course list, or

(b) the BCompSc and substituted in the BMath by a course at the same level or higher from the BMath course list.
